  16. open Asttypes
  17. open Parsetree

  19. ‌let string_of_cst = function
  20.   | Pconst_string(s, _, _) -> Some s
  21.   | _ -> None

  23. ‌let string_of_payload = function
  24.   | PStr[{pstr_desc=Pstr_eval({pexp_desc=Pexp_constant c},_)}] ->
  25.       string_of_cst c
  26.   | _ -> None

  28. ‌let string_of_opt_payload p =
  29.   match string_of_payload p with
  30.   | Some s -> s
  31.   | None -> ""

  33. ‌let error_of_extension ext =
  34.   let submessage_from main_loc main_txt = function
  35.     | {pstr_desc=Pstr_extension
  36.            (({txt = ("ocaml.error"|"error"); loc}, p), _)} ->
  37.         begin match p with
  38.         | PStr([{pstr_desc=Pstr_eval
  39.                      ({pexp_desc=Pexp_constant(Pconst_string(msg,_,_))}, _)}
  40.                ]) ->
  41.             { Location.loc; txt = fun ppf -> Format.pp_print_text ppf msg }
  42.         | _ ->
  43.             { Location.loc; txt = fun ppf ->
  44.                 Format.fprintf ppf
  45.                   "Invalid syntax for sub-message of extension '%s'." main_txt }
  46.         end
  47.     | {pstr_desc=Pstr_extension (({txt; loc}, _), _)} ->
  48.         { Location.loc; txt = fun ppf ->
  49.             Format.fprintf ppf "Uninterpreted extension '%s'." txt }
  50.     | _ ->
  51.         { Location.loc = main_loc; txt = fun ppf ->
  52.             Format.fprintf ppf
  53.               "Invalid syntax for sub-message of extension '%s'." main_txt }
  54.   in
  55.   match ext with
  56.   | ({txt = ("ocaml.error"|"error") as txt; loc}, p) ->
  57.       begin match p with
  58.       | PStr [] -> raise Location.Already_displayed_error
  59.       | PStr({pstr_desc=Pstr_eval
  60.                   ({pexp_desc=Pexp_constant(Pconst_string(msg,_,_))}, _)}::
  61.              inner) ->
  62.           let sub = List.map (submessage_from loc txt) inner in
  63.           Location.error_of_printer ~loc ~sub Format.pp_print_text msg
  64.       | _ ->
  65.           Location.errorf ~loc "Invalid syntax for extension '%s'." txt
  66.       end
  67.   | ({txt; loc}, _) ->
  68.       Location.errorf ~loc "Uninterpreted extension '%s'." txt

  70. ‌let kind_and_message = function
  71.   | PStr[
  72.       {pstr_desc=
  73.          Pstr_eval
  74.            ({pexp_desc=Pexp_apply
  75.                  ({pexp_desc=Pexp_ident{txt=Longident.Lident id}},
  76.                   [Nolabel,{pexp_desc=Pexp_constant (Pconst_string(s,_,_))}])
  77.             },_)}] ->
  78.       Some (id, s)
  79.   | PStr[
  80.       {pstr_desc=
  81.          Pstr_eval
  82.            ({pexp_desc=Pexp_ident{txt=Longident.Lident id}},_)}] ->
  83.       Some (id, "")
  84.   | _ -> None

  86. ‌let cat s1 s2 =
  87.   if s2 = "" then s1 else s1 ^ "\n" ^ s2

  89. ‌let alert_attr x =
  90.   match x.attr_name.txt with
  91.   | "ocaml.deprecated"|"deprecated" ->
  92.       Some (x, "deprecated", string_of_opt_payload x.attr_payload)
  93.   | "ocaml.alert"|"alert" ->
  94.       begin match kind_and_message x.attr_payload with
  95.       | Some (kind, message) -> Some (x, kind, message)
  96.       | None -> None (* note: bad payloads detected by warning_attribute *)
  97.       end
  98.   | _ -> None

  100. ‌let alert_attrs l =
  101.   List.filter_map alert_attr l

  103. ‌let alerts_of_attrs l =
  104.   List.fold_left
  105.     (fun acc (_, kind, message) ->
  106.        let upd = function
  107.          | None | Some "" -> Some message
  108.          | Some s -> Some (cat s message)
  109.        in
  110.        Misc.Stdlib.String.Map.update kind upd acc
  111.     )
  112.     Misc.Stdlib.String.Map.empty
  113.     (alert_attrs l)

  115. let check_alerts loc attrs s =
  116.   Misc.Stdlib.String.Map.iter
  117.     (fun kind message -> Location.alert loc ~kind (cat s message))
  118.     (alerts_of_attrs attrs)

  120. let check_alerts_inclusion ~def ~use loc attrs1 attrs2 s =
  121.   let m2 = alerts_of_attrs attrs2 in
  122.   Misc.Stdlib.String.Map.iter
  123.     (fun kind msg ->
  124.        if not (Misc.Stdlib.String.Map.mem kind m2) then
  125.          Location.alert ~def ~use ~kind loc (cat s msg)
  126.     )
  127.     (alerts_of_attrs attrs1)

  129. ‌let rec deprecated_mutable_of_attrs = function
  130.   | [] -> None
  131.   | {attr_name =  {txt = "ocaml.deprecated_mutable"|"deprecated_mutable"; _};
  132.      attr_payload = p} :: _ ->
  133.      Some (string_of_opt_payload p)
  134.   | _ :: tl -> deprecated_mutable_of_attrs tl

  136. ‌let check_deprecated_mutable loc attrs s =
  137.   match deprecated_mutable_of_attrs attrs with
  138.   | None -> ()
  139.   | Some txt ->
  140.       Location.deprecated loc (Printf.sprintf "mutating field %s" (cat s txt))

  142. ‌let check_deprecated_mutable_inclusion ~def ~use loc attrs1 attrs2 s =
  143.   match deprecated_mutable_of_attrs attrs1,
  144.         deprecated_mutable_of_attrs attrs2
  145.   with
  146.   | None, _ | Some _, Some _ -> ()
  147.   | Some txt, None ->
  148.       Location.deprecated ~def ~use loc
  149.         (Printf.sprintf "mutating field %s" (cat s txt))

  151. let rec attrs_of_sig = function
  152.   | {psig_desc = Psig_attribute a} :: tl ->
  153.       a :: attrs_of_sig tl
  154.   | _ ->
  155.       []

  157. ‌let alerts_of_sig sg = alerts_of_attrs (attrs_of_sig sg)

  159. ‌let rec attrs_of_str = function
  160.   | {pstr_desc = Pstr_attribute a} :: tl ->
  161.       a :: attrs_of_str tl
  162.   | _ ->
  163.       []

  165. ‌let alerts_of_str str = alerts_of_attrs (attrs_of_str str)

  167. ‌let check_no_alert attrs =
  168.   List.iter
  169.     (fun (a, _, _) ->
  170.        Location.prerr_warning a.attr_loc
  171.          (Warnings.Misplaced_attribute a.attr_name.txt)
  172.     )
  173.     (alert_attrs attrs)

  175. let warn_payload loc txt msg =
  176.   Location.prerr_warning loc (Warnings.Attribute_payload (txt, msg))

  178. let warning_attribute ?(ppwarning = true) =
  179.   let process loc txt errflag payload =
  180.     match string_of_payload payload with
  181.     | Some s ->
  182.         begin try
  183.           Option.iter (Location.prerr_alert loc)
  184.             (Warnings.parse_options errflag s)
  185.         with Arg.Bad msg -> warn_payload loc txt msg
  186.         end
  187.     | None ->
  188.         warn_payload loc txt "A single string literal is expected"
  189.   in
  190. ‌  let process_alert loc txt = function
  191.     | PStr[{pstr_desc=
  192.               Pstr_eval(
  193.                 {pexp_desc=Pexp_constant(Pconst_string(s,_,_))},
  194.                 _)
  195.            }] ->
  196.         begin try Warnings.parse_alert_option s
  197.         with Arg.Bad msg -> warn_payload loc txt msg
  198.         end
  199.     | k ->
  200.         match kind_and_message k with
  201.         | Some ("all", _) ->
  202.             warn_payload loc txt "The alert name 'all' is reserved"
  203.         | Some _ -> ()
  204.         | None -> warn_payload loc txt "Invalid payload"
  205.   in
  206.   function
  207.   | {attr_name = {txt = ("ocaml.warning"|"warning") as txt; _};
  208.      attr_loc;
  209.      attr_payload;
  210.      } ->
  211.       process attr_loc txt false attr_payload
  212.   | {attr_name = {txt = ("ocaml.warnerror"|"warnerror") as txt; _};
  213.      attr_loc;
  214.      attr_payload
  215.     } ->
  216.       process attr_loc txt true attr_payload
  217.   | {attr_name = {txt="ocaml.ppwarning"|"ppwarning"; _};
  218.      attr_loc = _;
  219.      attr_payload =
  220.        PStr [
  221.          { pstr_desc=
  222.              Pstr_eval({pexp_desc=Pexp_constant (Pconst_string (s, _, _))},_);
  223.            pstr_loc }
  224.        ];
  225.     } when ppwarning ->
  226.      Location.prerr_warning pstr_loc (Warnings.Preprocessor s)
  227.   | {attr_name = {txt = ("ocaml.alert"|"alert") as txt; _};
  228.      attr_loc;
  229.      attr_payload;
  230.      } ->
  231.       process_alert attr_loc txt attr_payload
  232.   | _ ->
  233.      ()

  235. ‌let warning_scope ?ppwarning attrs f =
  236.   let prev = Warnings.backup () in
  237.   try
  238.     List.iter (warning_attribute ?ppwarning) (List.rev attrs);
  239.     let ret = f () in
  240.     Warnings.restore prev;
  241.     ret
  242.   with exn ->
  243.     Warnings.restore prev;
  244.     raise exn


  247. ‌let warn_on_literal_pattern =
  248.   List.exists
  249.     (fun a -> match a.attr_name.txt with
  250.        | "ocaml.warn_on_literal_pattern"|"warn_on_literal_pattern" -> true
  251.        | _ -> false
  252.     )

  254. let explicit_arity =
  255.   List.exists
  256.     (fun a -> match a.attr_name.txt with
  257.        | "ocaml.explicit_arity"|"explicit_arity" -> true
  258.        | _ -> false
  259.     )

  261. let immediate =
  262.   List.exists
  263.     (fun a -> match a.attr_name.txt with
  264.        | "ocaml.immediate"|"immediate" -> true
  265.        | _ -> false
  266.     )

  268. let immediate64 =
  269.   List.exists
  270.     (fun a -> match a.attr_name.txt with
  271.        | "ocaml.immediate64"|"immediate64" -> true
  272.        | _ -> false
  273.     )

  275. (* The "ocaml.boxed (default)" and "ocaml.unboxed (default)"
  276.    attributes cannot be input by the user, they are added by the
  277.    compiler when applying the default setting. This is done to record
  278.    in the .cmi the default used by the compiler when compiling the
  279.    source file because the default can change between compiler
  280.    invocations. *)

  282. let check l a = List.mem a.attr_name.txt l

  284. let has_unboxed attr =
  285.   List.exists (check ["ocaml.unboxed"; "unboxed"])
  286.     attr

  288. let has_boxed attr =
  289.   List.exists (check ["ocaml.boxed"; "boxed"]) attr
